html:
A round-up of notable broker activity this morning from Europe's top-ranked* analysts:


** Evercore cuts L'Oreal OREP.PA to "in line" from "outperform", saying that while China and e-commerce will continue growing strong double-digits, it sees headwinds given the company's geographic and channel diversification

** Citigroup raises Finnish telecom service provider Elisa ELISA.HE to "neutral" from "sell", saying mobile service revenue is likely to return in 2021 (Full Story)

** Stifel raises Aveva AVV.L to "buy" from "hold", citing the recent share price weakness as the company prepares to close OSIsoft acquisition which, in broker's opinion, strengthens product offering and should lead to improved sales synergies


INITIATIONS AND REINSTATEMENTS

** Societe Generale initiates coverage of office property companies Alstria Office AOXG.DE, Inmobiliaria Colonial COL.MC, Merlin Properties MRL.MC with caution, as the market suffers the impact of COVID-19 (Full Story)

** It starts Spanish Colonial with "sell", asking why it has not taken the chance to benefit from wider diversification and scale as a truly pan-European office consolidator

** Spanish Merlin Properties gets "hold" from SocGen, which cites elevated risk in Spain, hit hard by the pandemic, even though the company is well-placed to ride this risk out

** SocGen shares Alstria Office management's concerns that the property market has been overstimulated by a loose monetary policy and that COVID-19 has heightened risks -- initiates the German company with "sell", advising to wait for a better entry point



(*Analyst rankings from Thomson Reuters StarMine. The scale is from 1-star to 5-star with 5 being the best. Analysts are ranked on earnings accuracy as well as relative performance of recommendations over trailing 12-month & 24-month periods.)



(( anna.banacka@tr.com ; anita.kobylinska@tr.com ))
